page.title: 04FARMING BY THE RIVER.
page.content: Farming in the area is controlled by the actions of the{River Severn.}The silt carried down by the floods makes the soil close to the river very heavy.{Cultivation}of this land is unsuitable so most of the land close to the river is used as pasture land for cattle and sheep.In the northwest of area{Gravel Hill Farm}is able to cultivate its land because of its soil make-up .Sugar beet,barley and wheat are their main crops .The barley is harvested in July and delivered to the local Maltings.The wheat harvested at the same time is shipped out of the area to be used in bread production. The sugar beet is harvested in September and sent to Allscott sugar beet factory.{Birds}attacking the ripening barley cause the farmer a lot of problems.
